alert.note: Alert for Central Chelan County; Western Chelan County; Western Okanogan County (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued October 23 at 1:21PM PDT until October 25 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FIRST MODERATE SNOW EVENT FOR THE INLAND NORTHWEST ARRIVES TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY... .Significant mountain snow accumulation above 3000 feet and measurable snow for lower elevations below 2500 feet. A robust and cold weather system will deliver mountain snow, lowland rain-snow, and colder overnight temperatures lingering through the remainder of the week. Mountain passes will be impacted by the heavy snowfall and lowland areas may see impacts to trees and sensitive vegetation from wet snow accumulation. ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TUESDAY TO 5 PM PDT WEDNESDAY ESPECIALLY ELEVATIONS ABOVE 3000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected especially elevations above 3000 feet. Total snow accumulations between 8 and 16 inches above 3000 feet and 1 to 6 inches below 3000 feet. * WHERE...Winthrop, Conconully, Stevens Pass, Highway 20 Washington Pass, Mazama, Plain, Leavenworth, Methow, Twisp, Loup Loup Pass, Holden Village, and Stehekin. * WHEN...From 11 AM Tuesday to 5 PM PDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be challenging and difficult over mountain passes and high elevation roadways. Theses winter weather conditions could impact the Tuesday evening and Wednesday morning commutes on higher elevation roadways and passes. Low elevation locations and roadways may see seasonal conditions and caution should be taken.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Central Chelan County; Western Chelan County; Western Okanogan County
